snippet: Listening to the car radio, I surrender control and let the D.J. take over.
abstract: Op-Ed article by writing teacher Beth Boyle Machlan describes how she has come to accept listening to the radio in her car, due to the fact that it is old and has a defective CD player; observes that she grew up listening to New York City's radio stations and is comfortable once again handing over control of her music, while she drives, to familiar voices.
lead_paragraph: Listening to the car radio, I surrender control and let the D.J. take over.

headline.main: Driving to the Music of Chance
